text: happy Thanksgiving guys are you ready to
make your mashed potatoes because I'm
ready to share one of my favorite

potatoes start with one and a half
pounds of russet potatoes those are
gonna yield some pretty fluffy mashed
potatoes I think peel them sometimes I
think the peels on for mashed potatoes
but not with russet potatoes so from
using like a small Yukon Gold or a red

this instance ever ever told you about

hand tell me what you're making for

Thanksgiving every year that'd be fun
so I make pies that I usually make like
4 pies if you follow me on instagram at
Sarah Carey one you'll see what kind of
pies I make this year cut the potatoes
into cubes they cut it kind of doesn't
matter how big they are but the smaller
they are the less time it will take to
cook but if they're too small they will
absorb too much water so let's say about
two inches this recipe can be doubled
tripled quadrupled just change the size
of the pot to be appropriate to the
amount of potatoes that you're cooking
pot of water the water should be cold
when you start I'm just I already have
my water in the pot but usually you put
the potatoes in then cover them with
water it needs to be covered by 2 inches
so that there's plenty of water around
the potatoes while they're cooking don't
forget to season bring it to a boil and
then cook it at like a pretty vigorous
simmer until the potatoes are very
tender that'll take about 15 minutes
they are tender they're done drain and
what I like to do is put the potatoes
back into the hot pot to get them dried
out that's how you get them nice and
fluffy some people like to bake their
potatoes for mashed potatoes my
colleague Lucinda she told me the other

fluffiest mashed potatoes which I

really thought of doing shake them a

and then what you do is you add 2/3 of a
cup of milk and the recipe only calls
for 2 tablespoons of unsalted butter you
can use 2 tablespoons use a little more
